name: translators
description: Translators is a library that aims to bring free, multiple, enjoyable translations to individuals and students in Python.  「翻译官」是一个旨在用Python为个人和学生带来免费、多样、愉快翻译的库。
readme_summary: The `translators` library is a Python package designed to provide access to multiple translation services, aiming to offer a free, diverse, and user-friendly translation experience for individuals and students. It supports a wide range of translation services, including well-known platforms like Google Translate, Yandex Translate, and others, offering a unified interface for accessing these services within Python applications.
key_features: Support for multiple translation services (Niutrans, MyMemory, Alibaba, Baidu, etc.)
Aimed at providing free translation services
Support for a large number of languages (varying by service)
primary_use_case: Providing a unified Python interface for accessing various translation services for text translation tasks.
cover_image_prompt: A multilingual scholar sitting at a grand library table, using a magical quill to effortlessly translate ancient texts from various languages into a single, modern language displayed on a holographic screen. Books with foreign scripts float around, their words transforming into the scholar's native tongue as they approach the quill. Subtle UI elements on the screen show translation options and language codes. The scene is bathed in warm, inviting light, with a globe displaying different countries in the background. The composition is focused and clear, with a harmonious color scheme. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: thingino-firmware
description: Open-source firmware for Ingenic SoC IP cameras
readme_summary: Thingino is an open-source firmware for Ingenic SoC IP cameras. It provides a build environment and pre-built binaries for creating custom firmware images, with stable and master branches for different development needs.
key_features: Open-source firmware for Ingenic SoC IP cameras
Stable and master branches for different development stages
Support for ONVIF server and Prudynt
Experimental features like Matroska, Opus, and improved file recording
primary_use_case: Creating and deploying custom firmware for Ingenic SoC IP cameras.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled clockmaker meticulously assembling tiny gears inside a miniature IP camera, representing the creation of custom firmware. The camera sits on a workbench surrounded by circuit boards and open-source code snippets projected as holographic diagrams. The clockmaker uses specialized tools to fine-tune the gears, ensuring smooth operation and enhanced features. A small screen displays the Thingino logo and build progress. The scene is set in a brightly lit workshop with a clean, organized aesthetic. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and intricate details.

name: PyPDFForm
description: :fire: The Python library for PDF forms.
readme_summary: PyPDFForm is a Python library designed for processing PDF forms. It provides functionalities to inspect form data requirements, fill forms using Python dictionaries, create form fields, extract pages, and merge multiple PDFs.
key_features: Fill PDF forms using Python dictionaries
primary_use_case: Automating PDF form filling and creation processes.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled calligrapher meticulously filling out a complex form with a magical pen that transforms ink into digital data. The form rests on a desk amidst stacks of blank PDFs and completed documents, subtly glowing with digital particles. A small screen displays a Python dictionary mirroring the form's fields. The scene is set in a bright, organized studio with a blend of traditional and modern elements. The composition is clean and focused with a warm color scheme. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: swaptop
description: swap usage monitor written in rust
readme_summary: Swaptop is a real-time swap usage monitor for Linux and Windows systems. It provides a TUI interface to list processes using swap, displays consumption per-process/per-software, and provides live-updating graphs of swap usage.
primary_use_case: Monitoring swap usage on Linux and Windows systems to identify processes consuming swap memory.
cover_image_prompt: A doctor with a stethoscope examines a computer server lying on an operating table. The server's screen displays a graph of memory usage, with a prominent 'SWAP' section highlighted. The doctor points to a specific process on the screen, indicating high swap consumption. Small UI elements showing process names and memory usage statistics float around the server. The scene is set in a clean, modern server room with bright lighting. The composition is focused and clear, with a blue and green color scheme. The image should be in a flat design style with clear iconography and labeled parts.

name: cassowary
description: Run Windows Applications on Linux as if they are native, Use linux applications to launch files files located in windows vm without needing to install applications on vm. With easy to use configuration GUI
readme_summary: Cassowary allows users to run Windows applications on Linux as if they were native, leveraging FreeRDP and remote app technology. It facilitates seamless file access between Linux hosts and Windows VMs, providing an easy-to-use configuration utility and application launcher.
key_features: Running Windows applications as if they were native applications
Opening files from a Linux host directly inside Windows applications
Using Linux apps to open files that are on a Windows VM
Allowing easy access between both the guest and host filesystems
Creating an application launcher for Windows application
primary_use_case: Running Windows applications seamlessly on Linux systems.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled carpenter seamlessly joining a wooden window frame (representing Windows applications) into a brick wall (representing the Linux OS). The carpenter uses specialized tools that glow with digital particles, ensuring a perfect fit. A blueprint subtly displays UI elements and code snippets related to application launching. The scene is set in a bright, modern workshop with a focus on precision and integration. The composition is clean and focused with a warm color scheme. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: lossless-cut
description: The swiss army knife of lossless video/audio editing
readme_summary: LosslessCut is a cross-platform FFmpeg GUI designed for fast, lossless video and audio editing. Its primary function is lossless trimming and cutting of media files, allowing users to quickly extract desired segments without re-encoding, thus preserving original quality and saving space.
key_features: Lossless cutting of most video and audio formats
Losslessly cut out parts of video/audio
Losslessly rearrange the order of video/audio segments
View technical data about all tracks and edit metadata
Losslessly remux video/audio into a different container format
Export ranges of video frames to images
primary_use_case: Lossless trimming and cutting of video and audio files to save space and extract desired segments without re-encoding.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a skilled artisan carefully sculpting a raw gemstone (representing a large video file) with precise tools. The artisan extracts a brilliant, smaller gem (the desired video segment) without altering its inherent quality. Digital interfaces subtly display waveforms and timestamps, connecting the artisan's work to software. The scene is set in a brightly lit workshop with a clean, focused composition. Glowing particles highlight the precision of the cuts. The repository name, LosslessCut, is subtly engraved on one of the tools. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: bake
readme_summary: The `bake` tool is a Linux CLI application written in Rust that embeds a microVM (using Firecracker) and its resources into a single executable. This allows users to run microVMs without root privileges, enabling bidirectional communication, networking, and directory sharing between the host and the VM.
key_features: Embeds Firecracker microVM resources into a single executable
Bidirectional communication between VM and host
Userspace implementation, no root privileges required
Includes an init sequence for preparing the root filesystem and launching the container process
primary_use_case: Creating standalone, self-contained microVM executables for running applications in isolated environments.
cover_image_prompt: A baker meticulously crafting a miniature world inside a glass dome, placing tiny servers, networks, and files into the dough. The dome glows with digital light, showcasing the complete microVM environment. The baker uses specialized tools to 'bake' the world into a single, golden loaf of bread, representing the standalone executable. Small UI elements display code snippets and system configurations. The scene is set in a clean, modern bakery with warm, inviting lighting. The composition is focused and balanced with a pastel color scheme. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: gramax
description: Embrace a docs-as-code approach to build, version, and publish Git-driven documentation sites using Markdown and a visual editor
readme_summary: Gramax is an open-source, local-first documentation tool that allows users to create, edit, version, and publish documentation sites using Markdown. It features a visual editor, Git integration, and supports multiple languages, aiming to provide a flexible alternative to traditional static site generators and platforms like GitBook.
key_features: Migration Support from Confluence and Notion
primary_use_case: Creating, versioning, and publishing documentation as code.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled cartographer meticulously crafting a detailed map of a vast library, each book representing a document. The cartographer uses a quill that emits glowing digital code as they write, seamlessly connecting the physical map to a digital interface displaying Git commit history. Small UI elements float around the scene, showing a visual editor and version control branches. The scene is set in a sunlit workshop filled with scrolls and books. The composition is focused and clear, with a warm color scheme. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.
